agent_profile_summary: Leticia Johnson, a 30-year-old marketing analyst in Denver, grew up in Honduras before moving to the U.S. as a child, where her parents instilled in her the value of education and hard work. A defining moment came when she ran for student government president during college, a decision that emerged from years of political curiosity and mentorship, ultimately shaping her career and commitment to public service. Today, she balances her full-time job with volunteering at a local food bank and community garden, reflecting her ongoing dedication to social justice and community support. Her life is guided by a tension between professional ambition and the desire to give back, evident in her thoughtful approach to work, relationships, and personal growth. Leticiaâ€™s warmth and grounded perspective stem from her belief in collective well-being and the power of small, consistent actions to create meaningful change.
